intro: Pectis vollmeri, commonly known as the velvetleaf pectis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive velvety texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Pectis vollmeri is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
